channel.title: Skyrim for PC or Xbox 360?
channel.description:
I want to buy Skyrim, it looks like fun and looks like it will take me a while to finish. Would it be better on my Xbox or on my computer? I have 8GB of DDR3 RAM, my CPU brand is Intel, and I have an Intel Core i5-2320 @ 3.0GHz. My screen resolution (if this even matters) is 1920x1080.
According to [url=http://www.game-debate.com/games/index.php?g_id=625&game=The%20Elder%20Scrolls%20V#systemRequirements]this[/url], I can run Skyrim fine.

item.title: Skyrim for PC or Xbox 360?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Oh… Well I don’t play many PC games, after I upgrade my graphics card I guess I’ll try a few then.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim for PC or Xbox 360?
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

Frell:

Yes its extremely unlikely youll be able to run it, just pirate it and see if you can run it. And if you can then buy it so you get access to all the awesome steam workshop mods

This. Steam Workshop gives the game x100 more playability.

tyb97:

I never play PC games except for a few that aren’t available for Xbox 360, how is it better? You guys just use the keyboard or a joystick?

The mods. Xbox doesn’t have any mods (that are legal) where on the PC it’s actively encourage to mod your game out, makes the game last much much longer than it already does.

Read full topic
